flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=56>>56 photos.
When Tim has 56 photos, then Paul has 56 + 10 photos = <<56+10=66>>66 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 56 photos + 66 photos = <<56+66=122>>122 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 122 photos = <<152-122=30>>30 photos.
#### 30

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 52, not 56. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
